intro: Paederia cruddasiana, commonly known as the broadleaf moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Paederia cruddasiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
